<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2007, total unrecognized compensation
    costs related to non-vested restricted stock was
    $7.2&#160;million with a weighted average remaining life of
    5&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Restricted Stock
    Valuation</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Restricted shares that vest based on the service provided by the
    recipient are valued at the fair market value of the
    Company&#146;s stock on the grant date. Restricted shares and
    RSUs that contain market conditions are valued using a Monte
    Carlo simulation. Due to the number of vesting possibilities
    based on when a market condition is attained, the performance
    options have been valued in multiple tranches. Restricted Stock
    with market conditions were valued on the grant date. RSUs were
    valued on December&#160;31, 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Deferred
    Compensation Plan</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company established a deferred compensation plan on
    April&#160;24, 2003 as part of its Incentive Compensation Plan
    that was approved by shareholders. The purpose of the
    Company&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan is to further the
    Company&#146;s ability to attract and retain high quality
    executives and non-employee directors. The Plan also furthers
    the retention of stock ownership of participants by facilitating
    deferral of gains resulting from the exercise of nonqualified
    stock options or the receipt of shares pursuant to awards under
    the Company&#146;s Stock Incentive Plan and the Incentive
    Compensation Plan, and conversion of cash compensation into
    deferred stock units representing the right to receive, on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">one-for-one</FONT>
    basis, shares of Company Common Stock. The Deferred Compensation
    Plan permits the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-37
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    deferral of base compensation, bonus compensation,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT> cash
    and the receipt of shares of Common Stock pursuant to exercises
    of non-qualified stock options and pursuant to other awards
    under the Company&#146;s Incentive Compensation Plan. The
    Deferred Compensation Plan is structured as a &#147;nonqualified
    plan&#148; under applicable IRS and Department of Labor
    guidelines. At December&#160;31, 2007 and 2006, 18,476 and
    16,814 deferred stock units, respectively, were recorded in the
    plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Savings and
    Retirement Plan</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company maintains The PrivateBancorp, Inc. Savings and
    Retirement Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) pursuant to
    Section&#160;401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code, whereby
    eligible employees may contribute a percentage of compensation,
    but not in excess of the maximum amount allowed under the Code.
    The banks can make discretionary contributions to the Plan as
    determined and approved by the bank&#146;s Board of Directors.
    Total discretionary contributions to the Plan amounted to
    $791,000 in 2007, $716,000 in 2006, and $527,000 in 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Directors and executive officers of the Company and the banks
    were clients of and had transactions with the banks in the
    ordinary course of business during the period presented above
    and additional transactions may be expected in the future. In
    management&#146;s opinion, all outstanding loans, commitments
    and deposit relationships included in such transactions were
    made on substantially the same terms, including interest rates
    and collateral, as those prevailing at the time for comparable
    transactions with others, and did not involve more than a normal
    risk of collectability or other unfavorable features.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    PrivateBancorp, Inc. engages Mesirow Financial Holdings
    (&#147;Mesirow&#148;), a financial services firm of which
    director James Tyree is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, as
    its broker to secure corporate insurance and company health and
    welfare benefit plans. Under various arrangements between the
    Company and Mesirow, Mesirow currently provides certain
    insurance brokerage and wealth management advisory services to
    the Company and/or its affiliates and its clients. In its
    capacity as the Company&#146;s insurance broker with respect to
    its corporate and health and welfare insurance programs and
    policies, Mesirow earned commissions equal to approximately
    $345,000 in 2007. Additionally, the PrivateWealth Group engages
    Mesirow Financial as one of its investment management firms and
    paid management fees of approximately $20,000 to Mesirow during
    2007. Additionally, from time to time, the Company refers
    clients to Mesirow for insurance services. During 2007, the
    Company earned approximately $23,000 in commissions related to
    referrals that secured coverage through Mesirow Financial.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2007, The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago paid Worknet,
    an information technology firm of which director William
    Castellano is chairman and CEO, $10,800 for services rendered,
    compared to $11,640 in 2006. In 2007, The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago paid $15,000 to The Law Offices
    of Alan Pearlman; Mr.&#160;Pearlman is the General Counsel of
    director Patrick Daly&#146;s company, The Daly Group LLC. The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago paid this firm $6,375 in 2006.
    During 2006, the Company paid $53,766 to the law firm of Neal,
    Gerber&#160;&#038; Eisenberg, for legal services. Phillip
    Kayman, one of the Company&#146;s directors, was previously a
    partner at Neal, Gerber&#160;&#038; Eisenberg. There were no
    expenses paid to this firm in 2007.
</DIV>

    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2007 and 2006, The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; St. Louis paid

    Rice&#160;&#038; Fingersh LC $102,863 in 2007 and $27,092 in

    Rice&#160;&#038; Fingersh LC. The PrivateBank&#160;&#150;
    St.&#160;Louis also paid Armstrong Teasdale LC $130,322 in 2007
    and $246,702 in 2006. St.&#160;Louis director, Steven Cousins,
    is a partner of Armstrong Teasdale.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Michigan paid $15,743 in 2007 and
    $17,073 in 2006 to McQueen Financial. The son of Pat McQueen,
    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Michigan&#146;s COO, is a principal
    at this investment management firm. The PrivateBank&#160;&#150;
    Michigan also paid $16,444 in 2007 and $8,088 in 2006 to
    Schellenberg&#160;&#038; Associates, where The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Michigan director Tom Schellenberg is
    affiliated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Mr.&#160;Mandell&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">daughter-in-law</FONT>
    is employed by The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago as a Managing
    Director. In 2007, she was paid an aggregate salary and bonus of
    $143,000. In 2006, she was paid an aggregate salary and bonus of
    $153,000, granted options to purchase 1,800&#160;shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock at an exercise price of $46.51 per
    share and awarded 1,000&#160;shares of restricted stock.

    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago. He received an aggregate
    salary and bonus of approximately $237,000 in 2007 and $236,000
    in 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;13&#151;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">DERIVATIVE
    FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS WITH
    OFF-BALANCE-SHEET RISK</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Derivative
    Financial Instruments</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    From time to time, the Company enters into certain derivative
    financial instruments as part of its strategy to manage its
    exposure to market risk. Market risk is the possibility that,
    due to changes in interest rates or other economic conditions,
    the Company&#146;s net interest income will be adversely
    affected.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s banking subsidiaries offer certain derivative
    products directly to qualified commercial borrowers. The Company
    economically hedges customer derivative transactions by entering
    into offsetting derivatives executed with a third party.
    Derivative transactions executed as part of this program are not
    designated as SFAS&#160;133 hedge relationships and are,
    therefore,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">marked-to-market</FONT>
    through earnings each period. In most cases, the derivatives
    have mirror-image terms, which results in the positions&#146;
    changes in fair value offsetting completely through earnings
    each period. However, to the extent that the derivatives are not
    a mirror-image, changes in fair value will not completely
    offset, resulting in some earnings impact each period. At
    December&#160;31, 2007, the aggregate notional value of interest
    rate swaps with various commercial borrowers totaled
    $56.0&#160;million and the aggregate notional value of interest
    rate swaps with third parties also totaled $56.0&#160;million.
    These interest rate swaps mature between August 2010 and
    December 2010. These swaps were reported on the Company&#146;s
    balance sheet as a derivative asset of $695,000 and a derivative
    liability of $695,000. At December&#160;31, 2006, the Company
    did not have any transactions of this type.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company does not enter into derivatives for purely
    speculative purposes. Our derivatives have not been designated
    as SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133 hedge relationships. These derivatives
    include commitments to fund certain mortgage loans to be sold
    into the secondary market and forward commitments for the future
    delivery of residential mortgage loans. It is the Company&#146;s
    practice to enter into forward commitments for the future
    delivery of fixed rate residential mortgage loans when interest
    rate lock commitments are entered into in order to economically
    hedge the effect of changes in interest rates on its commitments
    to fund the loans as well as on its portfolio of mortgage loans
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">held-for-sale.</FONT>
    At December&#160;31, 2007, the Company had approximately
    $1.1&#160;million of interest rate lock commitments and
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-39
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    $10.1&#160;million of forward commitments for the future
    delivery of residential mortgage loans. The fair values were
    estimated based on changes in mortgage rates from the date of
    the commitments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Credit Risk and
    Market Risk</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    By their nature, all financial instruments involve risk,
    including credit risk for nonperformance by counterparties. The
    contract or notional amounts of these instruments reflect the
    extent of involvement we have in particular classes of financial
    instruments. The maximum potential loss may exceed any amounts
    recognized in the Consolidated Balance Sheets. However, the
    Company&#146;s maximum exposure to credit loss in the event of
    nonperformance by the other party to the financial instruments
    for commitments to extend credit and financial guarantees is
    limited to the amount drawn and outstanding on those instruments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Exposure to credit risk is controlled through credit approvals,
    credit limits, obtaining collateral and continuous monitoring
    procedures and reserves for losses are established when deemed
    necessary.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    All financial instruments inherently expose the holders to
    market risk, including changes in interest rates. The Company
    manages its exposure to these market risks through our regular
    operating and financing activities and when appropriate, through
    the use of derivative financial instruments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Financial
    Instruments with Off-Balance-Sheet Risk</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has, through its subsidiaries, entered into
    credit-related instruments with off-balance-sheet risk in the
    normal course of business to meet the financing needs of its
    clients. These financial instruments include commitments to
    extend credit and standby letters of credit. These instruments
    involve, to varying degrees, elements of credit risk in excess
    of the amount recognized in the consolidated financial
    statements. Credit risk represents the loss that would be
    recognized at the reporting date if counterparties failed to
    completely perform as contracted.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our exposure to credit loss in the event of nonperformance by
    the other party to the financial instrument for commitments to
    extend credit and standby letters of credit is represented by
    the contractual amount of those instruments, assuming that the
    amounts are fully advanced and that collateral or other security
    is of no value. The banks use the same credit policies in making
    commitments and conditional obligations as it does for
    on-balance-sheet instruments. At December&#160;31, 2007 and
    2006, the banks had the following categories of credit-related
    financial instruments:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->

    Commitments to extend credit
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
    $
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
    1,686,143
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

    Standby letters of credit
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>

<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
    72,691
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

</TD>

    82,856
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Note: all commitments are shown at contract amount.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Commitments to extend credit are agreements to lend to a client
    as long as there is no violation of any condition established in
    the contract. Commitments generally have fixed expiration dates
    or other termination clauses and may require payment of a fee.
    Since many of the commitments are expected to expire without
    being drawn upon, the total commitment amounts do not
    necessarily represent future cash requirements. The banks
    evaluate each client&#146;s creditworthiness on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">case-by-case</FONT>
    basis. The amount of collateral obtained, if deemed necessary,
    upon extension of credit is based on management&#146;s credit
    evaluation of the counterparty. Collateral held varies but may
    include accounts receivable, inventory, property, plant and
    equipment and income-producing commercial properties.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Standby letters of credit are conditional commitments issued by
    the banks to guarantee the performance of a client to a
    third-party. Those guarantees are primarily issued to support
    commercial business activities of bank clients. The credit risk
    involved in issuing letters of credit is essentially the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-40
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    same as that involved in extending loan facilities to clients.
    The bank holds collateral supporting those commitments for which
    collateral is deemed necessary. It is the banks&#146; general
    policy to require third-party guarantees on all standby letters
    of credit regardless of the collateral used to secure a standby
    letter of credit. The majority of our standby letters of credit
    are secured by cash or other collateral.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table summarizes the maturity of standby letters
    of credit and commitments to extend credit:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition, at December&#160;31, 2007, the Company had
    approximately $10.1&#160;million in commitments to fund
    residential mortgage loans to be sold into the secondary market,
    compared to $10.3&#160;million at December&#160;31, 2006. These
    lending commitments are considered derivative instruments under
    the guidelines of SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133. The Company enters
    into forward contracts for the future delivery of residential
    mortgage loans at specified interest rates to reduce the
    interest rate risk associated with commitments to fund loans as
    well as mortgage loans held for sale. These contracts are also
    considered derivative instruments under SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133
    and totaled approximately $1.1&#160;million at December&#160;31,
    2007 and $945,000 at December&#160;31, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;14&#151;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">ESTIMATED FAIR
    VALUE OF FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following presents the carrying value and estimated fair
    value of the various classes of financial instruments held by
    the Company and its subsidiaries at December&#160;31, 2007 and
    2006. This information is presented solely for compliance with
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;107 &#147;Disclosures about Fair Value of
    Financial Instruments,&#148; and is subject to change over time
    based on a variety of factors. Because no active market exists
    for a significant portion of the financial instruments presented
    below and the inherent imprecision involved in the estimation
    process, management does not believe the information presented
    reflects the amounts that would be received if the
    Company&#146;s assets and liabilities were sold nor does it
    represent the fair value of the Company as an entity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Where possible, the Company has utilized quoted market prices to
    estimate fair value. Since quoted market prices were not
    available for a significant portion of the financial
    instruments, the fair values were approximated using discounted
    cash flow techniques. Fair value estimates are made at a
    specific point in time, based on judgments regarding future
    expected loss experience, current economic conditions, risk
    conditions, risk characteristics of various financial
    instruments and other factors. These estimates do not reflect
    any premium or discount that could result from offering for sale
    at one time the Company&#146;s entire holdings of a particular
    financial instrument. These estimates are subjective in nature
    and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment
    and, therefore, cannot be determined with precision. Changes in
    assumptions could significantly affect the estimates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-41
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

</TD>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following methods and assumptions were used to estimate the
    fair value of each class of financial instruments. These
    assumptions were based on subjective estimates of market
    conditions and perceived risks of the financial instruments at a
    certain point in time.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">a.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Cash and Cash
    Equivalents, Accrued Interest Receivable and Interest
    Payable</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For these short-term instruments, the carrying value
    approximates fair value because these instruments are short-term
    in nature and do not present unanticipated credit concerns.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">b.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Securities</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For securities held to maturity or
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale,</FONT>
    fair values are based on quoted market prices or dealer quotes.
    If a quoted market price is not available, fair value is
    estimated using quoted market prices for similar instruments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">c.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Loans Held for
    Sale</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Loans held for sale are carried at fair value. Fair value is
    determined based on quoted market rates or, in the case where a
    firm commitment has been made to sell the loan, the firm
    committed price.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">d.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Net
    Loans</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of performing loans is calculated by discounting
    scheduled cash flows through the estimated maturity using
    estimated market discount rates that reflect the credit and
    interest rate risk inherent in the loan. The estimate of
    maturity is based on the Company&#146;s and the industry&#146;s
    historical experience with repayments for each loan
    classification, modified, as required, by an estimate of the
    effect of current economic and lending conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Fair value for significant non-accrual (impaired) loans is based
    on estimated cash flows that are discounted using a rate
    commensurate with the risk associated with the estimated cash
    flows.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    F-42
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Assumptions regarding credit risk, cash flows and discount rates
    are determined using available market information and specific
    borrower information.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">e.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Interest Rate
    Swaps</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of interest swaps executed by the Company is
    determined based on the fair market value as quoted by
    broker-dealers.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">f.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Bank-Owned Life
    Insurance</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of bank-owned life insurance is equal to its cash
    surrender value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">g.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Deposit
    Liabilities</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of deposits with no stated maturity, such as
    non-interest-bearing deposits, interest-bearing deposits,
    savings and money market deposit accounts, is equal to the
    amount payable on demand as of year-end. The fair value of
    certificates of deposit and brokered deposits are based on the
    discounted value of contractual cash flows. The discount rate is
    estimated using the rates currently offered for deposits of
    similar remaining maturities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">h.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Funds
    Borrowed</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Rates currently available to the Company and the banks for debt
    with similar terms and remaining maturities are used to estimate
    fair value of existing debt.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">i.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Off-Balance Sheet
    Financial Instruments</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s commitments to originate loans and unused
    lines and outstanding letters of credit are primarily at
    market-based interest rates, and therefore there is no fair
    value adjustment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;15&#151;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">REGULATORY
    REQUIREMENTS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The banks are subject to federal and state laws, which restrict
    the payment of dividends to the Company. Based on these
    restrictions, at January&#160;1, 2008, The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago could have declared
    $127.8&#160;million in dividends without requesting approval of
    the applicable federal or state regulatory agency. As of
    January&#160;1, 2008, The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; St.&#160;Louis
    could have declared $11.7&#160;million in dividends without
    requesting approval of the applicable federal or state
    regulatory agency. As of January&#160;1, 2008, The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Michigan could have declared
    $10.9&#160;million in dividends without requesting approval of
    the applicable federal or state regulatory agency. The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Georgia could have declared $479,000 in
    dividends without requesting approval of the applicable federal
    or state regulatory agency as of January&#160;1, 2008. The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Wisconsin could not have declared
    dividends as of January&#160;1, 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The banks are required to maintain non-interest-bearing cash
    balances with the Federal Reserve based on the types and amounts
    of deposits held. During 2007 the consolidated clearing balance
    requirement with the Federal Reserve for all the bank
    subsidiaries was $250,000 and the consolidated reserve
    requirement was $2.4&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company and the banks are subject to various regulatory
    capital requirements as established by the applicable federal or
    state banking regulatory authorities. Under capital adequacy
    guidelines and the regulatory framework for prompt corrective
    action, the Company and the banks must meet specific capital
    guidelines that involve quantitative measures of the banks&#146;
    assets, liabilities and certain off-balance sheet items. The
    quantitative measures for capital adequacy require the Company
    and the banks to maintain minimum amounts and ratios of total
    and Tier&#160;1 capital to risk weighted assets and of
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-43
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Tier&#160;1 capital to average assets (leverage). The
    Company&#146;s and the banks&#146; capital components,
    classification, risk weightings and other factors are also
    subject to qualitative judgments by regulators. Failure to meet
    minimum capital requirements can initiate certain actions by
    regulators that, if undertaken, could have a material effect on
    the Company&#146;s financial statements. Prompt corrective
    action provisions are not applicable to bank holding companies.
    Management believes that as of December&#160;31, 2007, the
    Company and the banks meet all minimum capital adequacy
    requirements to which they are subject. To be categorized as
    well capitalized, an institution must maintain ratios as set
    forth in the following table. Management believes that no events
    or changes in conditions have occurred subsequent to such
    notification to change the bank&#146;s category.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    the Company (Consolidated), The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago,

    Georgia, and The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Wisconsin as of

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;16&#151;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">CONTINGENT
    LIABILITIES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Because of the nature of its activities, the Company is from
    time to time involved in legal actions that arise in the normal
    course of business. In the judgment of management, after
    consultation with legal counsel, none of the litigation to which
    the Company or its subsidiaries is a defendant is expected to
    have a material effect, either individually or in the aggregate,
    on the consolidated balance sheet, results of operations or cash
    flows of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Operating income:</B>

<TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Parent Company Only Statements of Changes in
    Stockholders&#146; Equity are the
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    same as the Consolidated Statements of Changes in
    Stockholders&#146; Equity.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-46
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">CONDENSED
    STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOWS (Parent Company Only)<BR>
    For the Years Ended December&#160;31, 2007, 2006 and
    2005</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;18&#151;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">CAPITAL
    TRANSACTIONS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2007 and 2006, the Company repurchased 235,397 and
    66,997&#160;shares, respectively, of its common stock in
    connection with the satisfaction of stock option exercises and
    minimum federal withholding tax requirements on the exercise of
    stock options and vesting of restricted stock and shares
    repurchased in the open market.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company sold 5,581,680&#160;shares of its common stock, and
    1,428.074&#160;shares of a newly created class of nonvoting
    convertible preferred stock in a private placement offering
    completed on December&#160;11, 2007. The convertible preferred
    shares have the same economic terms as the common shares in all
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-47
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES&#151;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    material respects, except that the preferred shares have no
    voting rights. The Company used the proceeds from the sale of
    the shares for working capital and general corporate purposes,
    including the support of the Strategic Growth Plan. The
    aggregate number of common and preferred shares issued
    represents 23.5% of the Company&#146;s common stock outstanding
    after the offering (assuming conversion of the preferred stock)
    and an increase in stockholders&#146; equity of
    $154.6&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">SIGNATURES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Pursuant to the requirements of Section&#160;13 or 15(d) of the
    Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused
    this report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly
    authorized.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 24pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 49%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    PRIVATEBANCORP, INC.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 48pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 49%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    By:<DIV style="display:inline; text-align:center; width:90%">/s/&#160;&#160;<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS">Larry
    D. Richman&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 2pt; margin-left: 49%; width: 100%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=467 length=0 -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 49%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Larry D. Richman,</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 49%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">President and Chief Executive
    Officer</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Date: February&#160;29, 2008
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-50
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">POWER OF
    ATTORNEY</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose
    signature appears below hereby constitutes and appoints Larry D.
    Richman and Christopher J. Zinski, and each of them, the true
    and lawful attorney-in-fact and agents of the undersigned, with
    full power of substitution and resubstitution, for and in the
    name, place and stead of the undersigned, to sign any and all
    amendments to this Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K,</FONT>
    and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto and other
    documents in connection therewith, with the Securities and
    Exchange Commission, and hereby grants to such attorneys-in-fact
    and agents, and each of them, full power and authority to do and
    perform each and every act and thing requisite and necessary to
    be done, as fully as to all intents and purposes as each of the
    undersigned might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and
    confirming all that said attorneys-in-fact and agents, or any of
    them, or their or his substitutes, may lawfully do or cause to
    be done by virtue hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of
    1934, this report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    has been signed by the following persons on behalf of the
    Registrant and in the capacities and on the dates indicated.

    Company hereby agrees to furnish a copy of any of these

    exhibit to the Company&#146;s Quarterly Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-Q</FONT>
    for the quarter ended September&#160;30, 2006 (File
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">No.&#160;000-25887)</FONT>
    and incorporated herein by reference).*
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">
    21
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    .1
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Subsidiaries of the Registrant(1)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
